intro: Draba hicksii, commonly known as Hick's whitlow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba hicksii is native to the western United States and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
